section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 1. Chapter 1: Certain Infectious and Parasitic Diseases > c. Infections resistant to antibiotics

content.full_text: Many bacterial infections are resistant to current antibiotics. It is necessary to identify all infections documented as antibiotic resistant. Assign a code from category Z16, Resistance to antimicrobial drugs, following the infection code only if the infection code does not identify drug resistance. (Evidence: pg no: 22, L51-L53)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding antibiotic-resistant infections using Z16 codes when resistance is not already specified in the primary infection code (Evidence: pg no: 22, L51-L53)
